Description: Shoulder sherd of possibly Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: from top, part of single black band above billet band between narrow black lines; below, to right of black handle zone, pendent lotus flower and bud frieze with added purple on buds on kalyxes and dot rosettes between flowers; broad reserved area below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Cook is not convinced that the oinochoe is Fikellura ware because of the unusual flower shape.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 10, no. 26151, pl. III)
Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 54, no. 185, pl. 43)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.118)
